Crimes.Legal_Issue: Mootness of judicial review application after removal date passed with stay in place
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants overstayed their visas, applied for refugee protection (which was refused), and sought deferral of removal based on pending humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application. A stay of removal was granted by the court.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed as moot
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The application is moot because there is no live controversy; the applicants remain in Canada due to the stay, and the enforcement officer’s refusal has no practical effect.
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign nationals with expired visas, claimants of refugee protection and H&C relief
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement officer refused to defer removal despite pending H&C application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Pending humanitarian and compassionate application warranting deferral of removal
Crimes.Legal_Standard: An application for judicial review becomes moot if there is no live controversy affecting the rights of the parties
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Whether adjudicating the issue would serve a useful purpose or resolve an ongoing dispute
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to removal orders and H&C considerations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of judicial review relative to scheduled removal date and issuance of stay
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on nature of decision under review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – case dismissed on procedural grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Existence of pending H&C application, removal order, stay granted by court
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Pending status of H&C application and compliance with interim stay
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Deferral of removal and judicial review of refusal decision
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A court will not decide a moot issue unless it serves a public interest or resolves a recurring controversy
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None identified – dismissal not based on lack of evidence
Crimes.Outcome: Dismissal of judicial review application without addressing merits
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No immediate harm established due to continued presence in Canada under stay
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visas, were denied refugee status, and sought deferral of removal based on pending H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court acknowledged administrative record including removal order and stay
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: None – matter turned on legal mootness, not factual disputes
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 117(1) – obligation to leave after expiry of status
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters and judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Limited – focused on procedural posture rather than factual evaluation
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No live controversy exists; deciding the issue would not affect the rights of the parties or provide practical benefit

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether judicial review of refusal to defer removal is moot after scheduled removal date passes and applicant remains in Canada
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants subject to removal order remained in Canada due to court-issued stay. Enforcement officer denied request to defer removal based on pending H&C application. Judicial review filed but removal date had passed before hearing.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of enforcement officer's refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The issue is moot because the removal did not occur and the申请人 already benefit from de facto deferral via court stay
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign nationals under removal order with pending H&C application
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement officer exercised discretion not to defer removal despite H&C application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Pending humanitarian and compassionate application requiring consideration prior to removal
Crimes.Legal_Standard: An application for judicial review must involve a live controversy to be justiciable
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Whether resolution of the issue would have any practical legal effect on the parties
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, particularly sections governing removal deferrals and H&C applications
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of judicial review following expiration of scheduled removal date
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard of review depends on nature of administrative decision, typically reasonableness
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – case decided on procedural mootness grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Removal order, record of pending H&C application, court-issued stay of removal
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 248 – authority to defer removal
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Existence and status of H&C application, validity of stay order
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Deferral of removal and quashing of refusal decision via judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Courts generally decline to hear cases lacking a live controversy unless they present issues of public importance
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found – dismissal based on procedural mootness
Crimes.Outcome: Dismissal of judicial review application without reaching merits
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No immediate harm demonstrated given ongoing stay preventing removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants failed to comply with removal order due to pending H&C claims and court-issued stay
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed administrative file and judicial stay documentation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions concerning compliance with removal orders (e.g., s. 117, s. 44)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: None – matter resolved on legal basis
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – remained beyond authorized period and under active removal order
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 44 – effect of removal order; s. 248 – deferral of removal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions and stays
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Focused on procedural record, not credibility or new evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No practical impact would result from ruling on the refusal since removal did not occur and applicants remain legally present under stay
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Doctrine of mootness in administrative and judicial review contexts
